title: Ajinkya Rahane

summary: Ajinkya Rahane is an Indian international cricketer.

value.label: Ajinkya Madhukar Rahane
Sangamner, Maharashtra, India
Indian
Middle-order right handed batsman

image.altText: Image of SV Joshi High School, Mumbai
image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 4.0 International license.

value.label: Rahane is a right-handed middle order batsman.

facts.label: First class Debut
facts.note: Rahane made his first-class debut, at the age of 19, for Mumbai against Karachi Urban in the Mohammad Nissar Trophy in September 2007

value.label: Mohammad Nissar Trophy was an annual first class cricket competition played over four days between the winners of the Ranji Trophy from India and Quaid-i-Azam Trophy from Pakistan.
The Ranji Trophy is a domestic first-class cricket championship played in India between teams representing regional and state cricket associations.
Rahane made his debut against England in 2011 as a replacement for opener Virender Sehwag
The England cricket team represents England and Wales in international cricket. England and Australia were the first teams to play a Test match in 1877.

value.label: Rahane was part of Indian team make it to the final of 2014 World T20
In the 2015 World Cup, Rahane only managed to score 208 runs from 8 matches
The 2015 ICC Cricket World Cup was the 11th Cricket World Cup, jointly hosted by Australia and New Zealand.
Rahane was initially in the Mumbai Indians squad but got limited opportunities

The Bangladesh national cricket team, popularly known as "The Tigers", is administered by the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB). Bangladesh is a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) with Test and One Day International (ODI) status.

image.altText: Image of Bangladesh national cricket team

value.label: Rahane has the highest number of catches (8) by a non wicketkeeper in a single Test match

image.altText: Rahane has the highest number of catches (8) by a non wicketkeeper in a single Test match

value.label: Rahane is the 5th Indian Batsman to score centuries in each innings of a Test

image.altText: Rahane is the 5th Indian Batsman to score centuries in each innings of a Test

value.label: Rahane was the first batsman to hit six fours in an over in IPL

value.label: Rahane is the fourth Indian batsman to score a Test century on their first match at the Lord's cricket ground.

image.altText: Rahane is the fourth Indian batsman to score a Test century on their first match at the Lord's cricket ground.

value.label: The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.

image.altText: Picture of India national cricket team

value.label: The Rajasthan Royals (often abbreviated as RR) are a franchise cricket team based in Jaipur, Rajasthan, that plays in the Indian Premier League.
Domestic Ranji trophy cricket team based in Mumbai
